channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-13530] Hive on Spark throws Kryo exception in some cases
item.description:
After recent changes, Hive on Spark throws KryoException:

16/04/14 21:53:24 INFO hiveserver2.DDLTest: ERROR : Failed to execute spark task, with exception 'java.lang.Exception(Failed to submit Spark work, please retry later)'
16/04/14 21:53:24 INFO hiveserver2.DDLTest: java.lang.Exception: Failed to submit Spark work, please retry later

item.summary: Hive on Spark throws Kryo exception in some cases

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I think this is my fault from HIVE-13410. The new field is bringing in all of codahale.

jxiang do you think it makes sense? Thanks.

This patch should fix this issue. However, I was wondering if we really need to serialize the perflogger object? If not, can we just fix class SparkHashTableSinkOperator not to use perflogger as a member field?

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12799018/HIVE-13530.patch

ERROR: -1 due to no test(s) being added or modified.

ERROR: -1 due to 3 failed/errored test(s), 9968 tests executed
Failed tests:

TestMiniTezCliDriver-vector_decimal_2.q-schema_evol_text_fetchwork_table.q-constprog_semijoin.q-and-12-more - did not produce a TEST-*.xml file
org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli.TestCliDriver.testCliDriver_partition_coltype_literals
org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli.TestMiniSparkOnYarnCliDriver.testCliDriver_index_bitmap3

Test results: http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/jenkins/job/PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build/7640/testReport
Console output: http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/jenkins/job/PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build/7640/console
Test logs: http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/logs/PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build-7640/

Messages:

Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.TestCheckPhase
Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.PrepPhase
Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.ExecutionPhase
Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.ReportingPhase
Tests exited with: TestsFailedException: 3 tests failed

This message is automatically generated.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12799018 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
jxiang aihuaxu do you think it makes sense?
Whoops I missed the comment, will take a look.
Seems to make sense to mark perLogger as transient in SparkHashTableSinkOperator rather than from PerfLogger class, similar to other operators like GroupByOperator, ListSinkOperator.
New patch marks the PerfLogger as transient.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12801068/HIVE-13530.2.patch

ERROR: -1 due to no test(s) being added or modified.

ERROR: -1 due to 67 failed/errored test(s), 9966 tests executed
